result.execSummary:
The defendant Garlon D Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All other conditions are the same as count 1.

Crt orders that the condition that the "no contact" provision of the def's bail be modified to allow him to contact M. Melissa D. via text or email for the sole purpose of discussing child care & visitation issues.

AMDENDED BOND:

- Defendant is allowed to have contact with M. Melissa D. via text or email for the sole purpose of discussing child care and visitation issues.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 10 p.m. and 6 a.m.

for bail modification. (def's)

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $1,000.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
-  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $3,000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with M. Melissa D.
  - Defendant shall not be at Schumann Cir.
  - Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
  - Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 10 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian, unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Status conference on July 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail
-  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $3000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with M. Melissa D.

  - Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 10 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian, unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
